citation.article-title: Thermaerobacter nagasakiensis sp. nov., a novel aerobic and extremely thermophilic marine bacterium.

p.s: Description of Themaerobacter nagasakiensis sp. nov.
Themaerobacter nagasakiensis (na.ga.sa.ki.en'sis M. L. adj. nagasakiensis pertaining to Nagasaki Prefecture)
Gramnegative, rod-shaped cells. 1.5–4 μm in length and 0.3–0.5 μm in width.
Motile by monopolar and dipolar flagellation.
Growth between 52 and 78 °C (optimum 70 °C), pH 5 and 8 (optimum pH 7) and 0–4.5% NaCl (optimum 1.0%).
Optimal doubling time, 40 min in JxT medium.
Heterotrophic growth with yeast extract and trypticase peptone.
G+C content of genomic DNA is 69 mol% (HPLC analysis).
16S rDNA sequence exhibits 98% similarity to that of Thermaerobacter marianensis.
Isolate was obtained from a hydrothermal vent, Tachibana Bay, Nagasaki Prefecture, Japan.
Type strain is Thermaerobacter nagasakiensis Ts1aT, =JCM11223T, DSM14512T.
